unnormalised: ## Finding My Balance: A Journey with Ayurveda in Kerala
normalised: ## Finding My Balance: A Journey with Ayurveda in Kerala

unnormalised: For years, I'd been feeling…off. You know, that perpetual state of sluggishness and mild anxiety that seems to creep in with modern life. Working in Mumbai, deadlines were always looming, and the stress levels were hitting the roof. Even my regular yoga sessions weren’t cutting it. Then, my friend Priya suggested something radical: an Ayurvedic retreat in Kerala.
normalised: For years, I'd been feeling…off. You know, that perpetual state of sluggishness and mild anxiety that seems to creep in with modern life. Working in Mumbai, deadlines were always looming, and the stress levels were hitting the roof. Even my regular yoga sessions weren’t cutting it. Then, my friend Priya suggested something radical: an Ayurvedic retreat in Kerala.

unnormalised: Honestly, I was skeptical. Ayurveda always seemed a bit… abstract. But Priya swore by it, attributing her incredible energy and calm to her yearly panchakarma. So, I booked a 10-day stay at the "Kerala Ayurveda Ashram" near Kochi, starting 10/11/2023.
normalised: Honestly, I was skeptical. Ayurveda always seemed a bit… abstract. But Priya swore by it, attributing her incredible energy and calm to her yearly panchakarma. So, I booked a ten day stay at the "Kerala Ayurveda Ashram" near Kochi, starting tenth november two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: From the moment I arrived, the atmosphere shifted. Lush greenery, the scent of sandalwood and herbs, and the gentle chanting – it was a world away from the Mumbai madness. The first consultation with Dr. Sharma involved a detailed examination of my “doshas” – Vata, Pitta, and Kapha – which, apparently, were way out of balance. He prescribed a personalized diet, daily oil massages (abhyanga), and herbal remedies.

unnormalised: The initial days were intense. Waking up at 06:00 hrs for yoga, followed by treatments that involved being covered in warm oil and spending time in a steam box. The food, though incredibly healthy and flavorful, was a far cry from my usual butter chicken cravings. There was this one concoction, "Kashayam," that tasted like a concentrated dose of bitter herbs – definitely not for the faint of heart!

unnormalised: However, slowly but surely, I started feeling the difference. The constant tension in my shoulders began to ease. I slept better than I had in years. My digestion improved. By day 7, I felt lighter, both physically and mentally. Even my skin was glowing!
normalised: However, slowly but surely, I started feeling the difference. The constant tension in my shoulders began to ease. I slept better than I had in years. My digestion improved. By day seven, I felt lighter, both physically and mentally. Even my skin was glowing!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma explained that it wasn't just about the treatments, but about learning to listen to my body and adopting a lifestyle more aligned with my natural constitution. He even gave me a list of herbs to take back to Mumbai, including Ashwagandha and Triphala.

unnormalised: Leaving Kerala on 20/11/2023, I felt like a new person. The journey wasn't a quick fix, but an investment in my long-term well-being. Now, back in the hustle of Mumbai, I try to incorporate the principles of Ayurveda into my daily life: mindful eating, regular meditation, and listening to my body's signals. It's a continuous journey, but one that's already made a profound difference. Maybe next year, I'll aim for a 14-day retreat, starting say, around 15/03/2024!
